children.value: Tab component for switching between different content areas.
Bind the index value corresponding to the currently active tag through
. The first tag is enabled by default.

props.code:
import { ref } from 'vue';
const active = ref(0);

children.value: of the current label (the label cannot be matched by the index value at this time).

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="activeName">
   <z-tab title="Tab 1" name="a">Content 1</z-tab>
   <z-tab title="Tab 2" name="b">Content 2</z-tab>
   <z-tab title="Tab 3" name="c">Content 3</z-tab>
</z-tabs>

import { ref } from 'vue';
const activeName = ref('b');

children.value: When the number of tabs exceeds 5, the tab bar can be scrolled horizontally, and the current tab will be automatically centered when switching.

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="active">
   <z-tab v-for="index in 8" :title="'tab ' + index">
     Content {{ index }}
   </z-tab>
</z-tabs>

children.value: A label can be disabled by setting the
style. You can switch the style through the
When a tab is clicked, the
Sticky layout can be turned on through the
attribute. Under sticky layout, the tab will automatically stick to the top when it is scrolled to the top.

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="active" sticky>
   <z-tab v-for="index in 4" :title="'options ' + index">
     Content {{ index }}
   </z-tab>
</z-tabs>

children.value: Tips: If there is other content at the top of the page, you can set the distance from the top through the offset-top property. A custom navigation bar needs to declare the custom-navbar attribute.
Shrink layout can be turned on through the
attribute. When turned on, all labels will be shrunk and aligned to the left.

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="active" shrink>
   <z-tab v-for="index in 4" :title="'options ' + index">
     Content {{ index }}
   </z-tab>
</z-tabs>

children.value: Label content can be customized through the

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="active">
   <z-tab v-for="index in 2">
     <template #title> <z-icon name="star" />Options </template>
     Content {{ index }}
   </z-tab>
</z-tabs>

children.value: The transition animation when switching tag content can be turned on through the

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="active" animated>
   <z-tab v-for="index in 4" :title="'options ' + index">
     Content {{ index }}
   </z-tab>
</z-tabs>

children.value: Swipe switching tabs can be enabled through the

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="active" swipeable>
   <z-tab v-for="index in 4" :title="'options ' + index">
     Content {{ index }}
   </z-tab>
</z-tabs>

children.value: The scroll navigation mode can be enabled through the
attribute. In this mode, the content will be displayed tiles.

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="activeScrollspy" scrollspy>
   <view style="height: 1000rpx">
     <z-tab
       v-for="(item, index) in 18"
       :key="index"
       :title="`Tag ${item}`"
     >
       <view class="demo-tab-item"> Content{{ item }} </view>
     </z-tab>
   </view>
</z-tabs>

children.value: attribute allows you to perform specific logic before switching tags.

props.code:
<z-tabs v-model:active="activeBefore" :before-change="beforeChange">
   <z-tab
     v-for="(item, index) in 4"
     :key="index"
     :title="`Tag ${item}`"
   >
     <view class="demo-tab-item"> Content{{ item }} </view>
   </z-tab>
</z-tabs>

children.value: Tips: Swiping through gestures will not trigger the before-change attribute.
The title bar of Tabs can not be rendered by setting the
. In this case, you can control the
property of Tabs through some custom components.
Bind the identifier of the currently selected tag
Animation time in seconds, set to 0 to disable animation
Whether to enable transition animation when switching tab content
Whether to display the outer border of the label bar, only valid when
Whether to omit too long title text
Whether to enable left shrink layout
Whether to enable left and right sliding switching with gestures
Whether to display the title bar
The distance from the top when ceiling is mounted in sticky layout, supports
Scroll threshold, horizontal scrolling starts when the number of tabs exceeds the threshold and the total width exceeds the width of the tab bar
switch The callback function before the label, returning
can prevent switching, and supports returning Promise
Whether to display a small red dot in the upper right corner of the title
The content of the logo in the upper right corner of the icon
When badge is the number 0, whether to display the logo
Triggered when a tab is clicked
{ name: string | number, title: string, event: MouseEvent, disabled: boolean }
Triggered when the currently active label changes
Triggered when scrolling, only effective in sticky mode
Through ref, you can get the Tabs instance and call the instance method.
This method can be called to trigger redrawing when the size of the outer element or the display state of the component changes
Scroll to the specified tab, available in scroll navigation mode
Content on the left side of the tab bar
Content on the right side of the tab bar
The component provides the following CSS variables, which can be used to customize styles. For usage, please refer to

html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
